intro: Calyptrion orinocense, commonly known as the Orinoco calyptrion, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela and Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 10 centimeters in diameter. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a hairy texture. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shady environments.
